_header: After the day that made is for travail
Title(s): ‘Of loue and his goode folkis alle’
_description:
‘Of loue and his goode folkis alle’, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 144) — twenty-two 8-line stanzas

BLHar682.First Lines:
AFtir the day that made is for travayleEnsewith nyght the werre in
                    to rest…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Vnto yong folke to loue hem to convertOf lovis werk bi
                    resignacioun
